New Room Arrangement

April 15, 2019

Author: Bianca Yang
Email: ipacifics@gmail.com

I recently rearranged the furniture in my room so my desk would face out my window. (Thank goodness Caltech has not heeded Munger’s advice regarding “window fetishes”.) I contemplated this move when I first moved into the room but I didn’t execute it until about four furniture rearrangements later. The main disadvantage of this setup is that my back is to the door. This is not the ideal setup because sitting with your back to the door exposes you to potential threats. It probably also raises my cortisol levels because I’m now spending more effort trying to listen for people moving around or through my door. Other than that, I think the benefit of looking out the window and being able to rest my myopic eyes outweighs the stress of having my back to the door. Besides, I can always just shut my door.
